greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: In binary representation of n: replace each 0 with 1, and each 1 with 10.
comment: All terms are numbers with no two adjacent zeros in binary representation, cf. A003754;
A023416(a(n)) <= A000120(a(n)), equality iff n = 2^k - 1 for k > 0;
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: n = sum (b(i)*2^i: i=0..l) with 0<=b(i)<=1, L>=0, then a(n) = h(0,L) with h(v,i) = if i>L then v else h((2*v+1)*(b(i)+1),i-1)
program: a196168 n = foldl (\v b -> (2 * v + 1)*(b + 1)) 0 $ reverse $ unfoldr
(\x -> if x == 0 then Nothing else Just $ swap $ divMod x 2) n
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 28 2011
